page.title: 15CRANFIELD CHURCH
page.content: In the centre of the village of Cranfield is the parish church of St. Peter and St.Paul. It is situated opposite the lower school and close to the public house :The Swan. The history of the church goes back to the Normans. After at first being a wooden building it was constructed of stone towards the end of the 12th century. There is a list of the rectors of the parish on a board inside the porch. One of the rectors of Cranfield, Thomas de Neuby, died of the Black Death when about one third of the population of the village died of the plague. The present rector is the Rev. D. Hunt. The east window is the oldest in the church, but the oldest part of the church seems to be the stone carving in the wall by the south doorway.
